Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/16/2017.

Description: CarMax agreed to pay $1 million in civil penalties, $300,000 in costs and $300,000 for supplemental environmental projects in settlement of a case by the District Attorney Offices of the counties of Alameda, Orange, Riverside, Los Angeles, San Bernardino, Fresno, Stanislaus, Kern, Ventura, Sacramento, Placer, San Diego, Solano, Sonoma, Santa Clara, San Mateo and Contra Costa,  which alleged unlawful handling and disposal of hazardous material, hazardous waste, and confidential consumer information.  The distribution of the settlement between the District Attorney Offices was not noted.

Info Source: Contained in a spreadsheet received from the agency on October 2, 2020 in response to an open records request. The spreadsheet included data from  the agency's Oculus database, which can be searched at https://prodenv.dep.state.fl.us/DepNexus/public/searchPortal
Notes: Case number is the designation given by the DEP's Office of General Counsel.
